question: In order to obtain an income of Rs. 650 from 10% stock at Rs. 96, one must make an investment of:
answer_description: To obtain Rs. 10, investment = Rs. 96.To obtain Rs. 650, investment = Rs.96x 650= Rs. 6240.10

question: A man bought 20 shares of Rs. 50 at 5 discount, the rate of dividend being 13. The rate of interest obtained is:
answer_description: Investment = Rs. [20 x (50 - 5)] = Rs. 900.Face value = Rs. (50 x 20) = Rs. 1000.Dividend = Rs.27x1000= Rs. 135.2100Interest obtained =135x 100%= 15%900

question: Which is better investment:  11% stock at 143  or  9% stock at 117?

options.D: Cannot be compared, as the total amount of investment is not given.

answer_description: Let investment in each case be Rs. (143 x 117).Income in 1stcase = Rs.11x 143 x 117= Rs. 1287.143Income in 2ndcase = Rs.39x 143 x 117= Rs. 1394.254 x 117Clearly, 93% stock at 117 is better.4

question: A man buys Rs. 20 shares paying 9% dividend. The man wants to have an interest of 12% on his money. The market value of each share is:
answer_description: Dividend on Rs. 20 = Rs.9x 20= Rs.9.1005Rs. 12 is an income on Rs. 100.Rs.9is an income on Rs.100x9= Rs. 15.5125

question: By investing in 16% stock at 64, one earns Rs. 1500. The investment made is:
answer_description: To earn Rs.50, investment = Rs. 64.3To earn Rs. 1500, investment = Rs.64 x3x 1500= Rs. 5760.50
